pattern.name: Zero crossing
pattern.description:
Count of how many times zero was crossed.
Note: In the edge conditions such as 4 consecutive points {-1,0,0,1} we have to make a decision, whether to consider this scenario as 1 or 2 zero crossings. With the presented implementation, 2 crossings would be counted.
Note: Sometimes we may want to count only transitions from negative to positive numbers (or reversely). However, in this implementation both directions are counted.
Note: The inequality signs "less than" and "greater than" have to be escaped in XML.
pattern.example: If balance at the account often crosses zero, the customer could be interested into a better credit card.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: WITH intermediate AS ( SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , @numericalColumn nowValue , LAG(@numericalColumn) OVER (PARTITION BY @baseId, @baseDate ORDER BY @timeColumn) AS lagValue FROM @propagatedTable ) SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , sum(CASE WHEN SIGN(nowValue) <> SIGN(lagValue) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS "@columnName" FROM intermediate GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget
